moves.1... e5 2. Nf3: brought his Knight out to threaten E5 pawn
moves.2... Nc6: I protected it with the Knight
moves.3... Nge7: but then I brought out the other one to protect  the Knight
moves.4. Nc3 a6: I then went A6 to move the Bishop away
moves.5... Nxc6: Which I then captured with the Knight
moves.6. d3 Bb4: I brought my Bishop out so I could castle should I need to whilst pinning the Knight
moves.7. a3: He then tried to drive the Knight away with A3
moves.7... Bxc3+: but I took the Knight because if he captured with the B2 pawn he would have double Pawns
moves.8... O-O: I decided to castle has I didn't have many other options
moves.9. Bb2: He then went Bb2 so that when he moves the C3 Pawn he would be threating the E5 pawn
moves.9... d6 10. h3: He did  H3 to prevent my Bishop going to G4 to pin the knight
moves.10... Be6 11. c4: He then moved to C4 to limit where my Bishop can move to
moves.14... Bxh3: which then I went the H3 pawn with the Bishop and I maybe down on material value but now his King will be exposed should he take
moves.15... Qg5+: I brought the Queen whilst delivering check
moves.16. Kh2 Qe5+: I did again but with Qd4 next move
moves.17. Kh1 Qxd4: We are now even on material valuie
moves.18. Rg1: He then move his Rook to G1 to make it more active
moves.18... c6 19. Qg4: He then went Qg4 to attack G7 but my Queen is protecting it
moves.19... g6: To be on the safe side I went g6
moves.20. h4: he then went H4 and then was going to go H5
moves.20... h5: But I went there not realising at the time he could take it whilst I couldn't take back with the Rook pinning the G6 Pawn
moves.21... Qxf2 22. Qh6: He moved Qh6 to stop my King moving
moves.22... Qxh4+: I then took the Pawn whilst putting my opponent in check
moves.23. Kg2 Qg4+: I then put him in check again and then I thought he would either do Kf2 or Kf1
moves.24... Qh3#: which then I did Qh3 checkmate

opening: Ruy Lopez (C60), Cozio defence, Paulsen variation
